revised_title: Time-resolved Ion Cyclotron Resonance: A Technique for Studying Ion-molecule Reactions
tldr: The article presents a critical evaluation of the ion cyclotron resonance (ICR) technique for studying ion-molecule reactions at near-thermal interaction energies. The authors propose a modification to the ICR method that eliminates uncertainties in the method and allows for the measurement of reaction rate constants. They discuss the experimental conditions and limitations of the technique, and provide suggestions for future improvements.
